deleteDataItems(com.google.android.gms.c.Description: Removes all specified @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ from the Android Wear network. If uri is fully specified, this method will delete at most one data item. If uri contains no host, multiple data items may be deleted, since different nodes may create data items with the same path. See @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi_E@ for details of the URI format. The filterType parameter changes the interpretation of uri. For example, if uri represents a path prefix, all items matching that prefix will be deleted.
deleteDataItems(com.google.android.gms.c.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataApi.DeleteDataItemsResult> deleteDataItems (GoogleApiClient client, Uri uri, int filterType)

getDataItem(com.google.android.gms.commo.Description: Retrieves a single @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ from the Android Wear network. A fully qualified URI must be specified. The URI's host must be the ID of the node that created the item. See @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi_E@ for details of the URI format.
getDataItem(com.google.android.gms.commo.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataApi.DataItemResult> getDataItem (GoogleApiClient client, Uri uri)

getFdForAsset(com.google.android.gms.com.Description: Retrieves a ParcelFileDescriptor pointing at the bytes of an asset. Only assets previously stored in a @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ may be retrieved.
getFdForAsset(com.google.android.gms.com.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataApi.GetFdForAssetResult> getFdForAsset (GoogleApiClient client, DataItemAsset asset)

removeListener(com.google.android.gms.co.Description: Removes a data listener which was previously added through @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi#addListener_E@.
removeListener(com.google.android.gms.co.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> removeListener (GoogleApiClient client, DataApi.DataListener listener)

getDataItems(com.google.android.gms.comm.Description: Retrieves all @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ from the Android Wear network. Callers must call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#data#AbstractDataBuffer#release_E@ on the returned buffer when finished processing results.

deleteDataItems(com.google.android.gms.c.Description: Removes all specified @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ from the Android Wear network. If uri is fully specified, this method will delete at most one data item. If uri contains no host, multiple data items may be deleted, since different nodes may create data items with the same path. See @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi_E@ for details of the URI format.
deleteDataItems(com.google.android.gms.c.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataApi.DeleteDataItemsResult> deleteDataItems (GoogleApiClient client, Uri uri)

getDataItems(com.google.android.gms.comm.Description: Retrieves all @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ matching the provided URI and filter type, from the Android Wear network. The URI must contain a path. If uri is fully specified, at most one data item will be returned. If uri contains no host, multiple data items may be returned, since different nodes may create data items with the same path. See @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi_E@ for details of the URI format. Callers must call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#data#AbstractDataBuffer#release_E@ on the returned buffer when finished processing results. The filterType parameter changes the interpretation of uri. For example, if uri represents a path prefix, all items matching that prefix will be returned.
getDataItems(com.google.android.gms.comm.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataItemBuffer> getDataItems (GoogleApiClient client, Uri uri, int filterType)

getFdForAsset(com.google.android.gms.com.Description: Retrieves a ParcelFileDescriptor pointing at the bytes of an asset. Only assets previously stored in a @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ may be retrieved.
getFdForAsset(com.google.android.gms.com.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataApi.GetFdForAssetResult> getFdForAsset (GoogleApiClient client, Asset asset)

getDataItems(com.google.android.gms.comm.Description: Retrieves all @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ matching the provided URI, from the Android Wear network. The URI must contain a path. If uri is fully specified, at most one data item will be returned. If uri contains no host, multiple data items may be returned, since different nodes may create data items with the same path. See @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi_E@ for details of the URI format. Callers must call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#data#AbstractDataBuffer#release_E@ on the returned buffer when finished processing results.
getDataItems(com.google.android.gms.comm.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataItemBuffer> getDataItems (GoogleApiClient client, Uri uri)

putDataItem(com.google.android.gms.commo.Description: Adds a @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ to the Android Wear network. The updated item is synchronized across all devices.
putDataItem(com.google.android.gms.commo.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<DataApi.DataItemResult> putDataItem (GoogleApiClient client, PutDataRequest request)

addListener(com.google.android.gms.commo.Description: Registers a listener to receive data item changed and deleted events. This call should be balanced with a call to @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi#removeListener_E@, to avoid leaking resources. The listener will be notified of changes initiated by this node.
addListener(com.google.android.gms.commo.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> addListener (GoogleApiClient client, DataApi.DataListener listener)

ClassDesc: Exposes an API for components to read or write A @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem_E@ is synchronized across all devices in an Android Wear network. It is possible to set data items while not connected to any nodes. Those data items will be synchronized when the nodes eventually come online. Data items are private to the application that created them, and are only accessible by that application on other nodes. They should generally be small in size, relying on @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataItem#getUri_E@, that indicates the item's creator and path. Fully specified URIs follow the following format: @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#Node#getId_E@ of the wearable node that created the data item, and <path> is an application-defined path. This means that given a data item's URI, calling @B_android#net#Uri#getHost_E@ will return the creator's node ID. In some of the methods below (such as @B_com#google#android#gms#wearable#DataApi#getDataItems_E@), it is possible to omit the node ID from the URI, and only leave a path. In that case, the URI may refer to multiple data items, since multiple nodes may create data items with the same path. Partially specified data item URIs follow the following format: / after wear:. Creator owns data items: Data items may be updated only by the original creator node. Producer-consumer: One node is responsible for creating a data item, and a second node is responsible for deleting it, once it has been processed. Data items should have unique IDs when using this pattern, and data items should not be modified once created.
